messageBody:
I'm using the following technique to run tests:
public class ConverterBeanTest extends TestCase {
public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(ConverterBeanTest.class);
}
}
I want the working directory at the same level as the source, one up
from the project root.
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Shane Duan <sduan@b...> wrote:
> Are you using some kind of test discovery class as your test
suite? If
> so, try to set the working directory as the parent of your src
directory.
>
> junitguy wrote:
>
> >I keep my source files in a "src" directory. When I build with
Ant,
> >I compile my class files into a "build" directory. I would like
to
> >then run JUnit tests against the newly created classes in the
build

are

good
